intro: Aetheopappus balansae, commonly known as the Balansae goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Aetheopappus balansae is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy species well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
